content.description: Keep on Bumpin' climbs the blunt arete/corner right of the start of Arc Crack. Start standing and climb on sloping crimps up perfect rock to the horizontal part of Arc Crack. Traverse right along the crack to finish. This is a great test of contact strength.Â
Friends of the Border is the straight-up variation of Arc Crack. Crank the steep start, and instead of following the crack right, head straight up the slab to the top.
content.location: South face of the Arc Boulder

content.description: French Faith climbs the arete/corner left of Arc Crack. Start standing and use bad holds to top out. The sit start is a great looking project.

The Arc Crack starts on the south side of the Arc Crack Boulder. Start standing with both your hands in the fingercrack. Crank a few hard moves to get your feet established above the steep wall. Then follow the crack right as it traverses the whole east face of the boulder. Top out easily up and right.  

  This is a really unique problem because of its traversing nature and its length. The sit start is a project, and looks to include excellent 5.13+/14- crack moves to gain the stand start.
content.location: Start on the south face of the boulder and traverse right to the east face.

content.description: This is the second largest boulder in the area. It connects somewhat to the Wander Boulder and can be identified by a beautiful arcing crack on the south side.
